lines.text:
[blessing the torture instruments with holy water]
We humbly beg of thee almighty God, in thy goodness, bless these instuments thou has created and given to us for our sacred use...
Devils in pieces of wood now, Barre?

[pouring holy water on Grandier's legs]
If they are not driven out, your devils might, by their infernal arts, prevent the torture being as excruciating as it should be. Then you would never confess, and your soul would be damned for eternity. Are you ready to confess?
I have been a man. I have loved women. I have enjoyed power.
That's not what we want. You've been a magician. You've had commerce with devils!
Kiss! Kiss! Kiss! Kiss!
[Mignon gives Grandier the kiss of peace]
Judas! Judas! Judas! Judas!

Lies! Lies and heresy. The Devil is a liar, and the father of lies. If the Devil's evidence is to be accepted, the most virtuous people are in the greatest of danger, for it against these that Satan rages most violently. I had never set eyes on Sister Jeanne of the Angels until the day of my arrest, but the Devil has spoken, and to doubt his word is sacrilege.

[about to burn Grandier at the stake]
Confess you are the Devil's servant! Renounce your master!
I am about to meet the God who is my witness! And I have spoken the truth!

[brandishing the flaming torch and moving closer to Grandier]
Confess! Confess! You have only a moment to live!
Only a moment, but then I face the just and fearful judgment that you too, reverend father, will soon be called.

[starting the fire]
May your body be consumed by eternal fire!
Don't look at me! Look at your city! If your city is destroyed, your freedom is destroyed also... If you would remain free men, fight. Fight them or become their slaves.

Whore! Strumpet! Hypocrite! You tell me you have no vocation? Of course you have a vocation! Fornicator! Fornicator! Sacrilegious bitch! Seducer of priest, that's your calling! Your place is in a brothel. You filthy whore! Get back to the gutter where you belong!

[shooting a prisoner dressed as a bird]
Bye bye, blackbird!
I'm pregnant.
And so it ends.
Satan is ever ready to seduce us with sensual delights.
Hold my hand. It's like touching the dead, isn't it?
Sin can be caught as easily as the plague.

[Talking about Jeanne]
Anything found in the desert of a frustrated life can bring hope. With hope comes love. With love comes hate. So I possess her. May God help her in her misery and unhappiness.
What fresh lunacy is this? A crocodile?
They always spoke of your beauty, and now I see it with my own eyes and it is true.
Look at this thing that I am and learn the meaning of love.

[holding up Grandier's baby as Grandier burns at the stake]
Watch, bastard. See how your mother's honor was avenged.
Lucky little bastard! It's not every day Baby sees Daddy burn to death.
give me three lines of a man's handwriting and I will hang him.
[to Grandier]
Hell will hold no surprises for you.
Call me vain and proud, the greatest sinner ever to walk God's earth, but Satan's boy I could never be. I haven't the humility.
Oh, Christ, let me find a way to you. Take me in your sacred arms. Let the blood flow between us uniting us. (moans) Grandier. Grandier!
A nun is reported to be having commerce with your Isacaaron in the form of a three-legged dog.
A most original conception, your Majesty, The Birth of Venus. I pray I may assist you in the birth of a new France, where Church and State are one.
[He holds out his hand to Louis, who kisses his ring]

[intoning]
And may the Protestant be driven from our land...
St Paul says that he who marries does a good thing, but he who remains chaste does something better.
Then I am content to do a good thing and leave the best to those that can face it.

[in bed with Philippe]
Your father sends you here for instruction in Latin, and we must not deceive him.
Reverend Father, I notice that you don't speak to these creatures in Latin as is usual. Why is that?
They're not conversant with the language. You'll understand, sire, there are uneducated as well as educated devils.

[in a growling voice as she crawls like a crab]
I haven't travelled much.
Quite.

My lords, I am innocent of the charges. And I am afraid. But I have the hope in my heart that, before this day ends, Almighty God will glance aside and let my suffering atone for my vain and disordered life. Amen.
There are 6,000 Christian souls waiting for you in the marketplace. Tell me, do you love the Church?
Not today.
are you any longer important?
I was never important.
Then make a last supreme gesture to the Catholic faith.

[after having Grandier dragged through the streets following his torture, they arrive at the Convent where Grandier is to beg forgiveness]
Get up.
What is this place?
The Convent of St Ursulla, a place you have defiled. Do what must be done.
[he tips Gradier off the stretcher he is on]

Most religions believe that by crying, "Lord, Lord!" often enough, they can contrive to enter the kingdom of heaven. A flock of trained parrots could just as readily cry the same thing with just as little chance of success.

[to Sister Jeanne]
My dear sister in Christ, I must question you.
Good morning! Did you sleep well?
With all this noise?
There are thousands of them out there. Where do you expect them to get all the beds from? Besides, they're all too excited.
About what?
Oh...
[pretends to have forgotten for a moment]
Your execution.
I have not been tried yet.
All right, have it your own way. Your trial then.
[immediately after, a soldier smashes a statue]
I am a simple person I see the world as I have been taught,yet I would not be afraid to go before god with you even in our sin.
You shame me.
true sign of the devil.
What effect would the close proximity of this relic have on devils such as these?
It would put them to flight.
At once?
Immediately. Although I could not guarantee that, once the relic was removed, they would not return.
Of course not. That would be asking too much.

[tossing Grandier's charred bone on the floor in front of Sister Jeanne]
I almost forgot - souvenir!

For the love of Jesus Christ! If you wish to destroy me, then destroy me. Accuse me of exposing political chicanery and the evils of the state, and I will plead guilty! But who would not hold back some scraps to prove to himself, in his dotage, that he was once loved?
Wait! Do you have a mirror?
"Give me three lines of a man's handwriting and I will hang him".
